metadata.Title: CVE-2011-4110 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The user_update function in security/keys/user_defined.c in the Linux kernel 2.6 allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and kernel oops) via vectors related to a user-defined key and "updating a negative key into a fully instantiated key." A flaw was found in how the Linux kernel handles user-defined key types. An unprivileged local user could exploit this to crash the system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4110` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19

No subscription required
